com.mr_apps.androidbase.utils

Class CustomDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mr_apps.androidbase.utils.CustomDialog

  • public class CustomDialog
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains a lot of useful methods to create standard dialogs
    Author:
    Mattia Ruggiero, Denis Brandi

      • showOkDialog

        public static void showOkDialog(android.content.Context context,
                java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String message,
                CustomDialog.StandardDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a standard dialog with only a ok button
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        title - the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        message - the message of the dialog
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "Ok" tap

      • showOkDialog

        public static void showOkDialog(android.content.Context context,
                java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.String buttonText,
                CustomDialog.StandardDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a standard dialog with only a ok button
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        title - the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        message - the message of the dialog
        buttonText - the text of the positive button of the dialog
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "Ok" tap

      • showOkDialog

        public static void showOkDialog(android.content.Context context,
                int titleResId,
                int messageResId,
                CustomDialog.StandardDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a standard dialog with only a ok button
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        titleResId - the string's resource id of the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        messageResId - the string's resource id of the message of the dialog
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "Ok" tap

        titleResId - the string's resource id of the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        messageResId - the string's resource id of the message of the dialog

                java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.String buttonText)
        Shows a standard dialog with only a positive button with a customizable tap's action
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        title - the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        message - the message of the dialog
        buttonText - the text of the positive button of the dialog

      • showOkDialog

        public static void showOkDialog(android.content.Context context,
                int titleResId,
                int messageResId,
                int buttonTextResId)
        Shows a standard dialog with only a positive button with a customizable tap's action
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        titleResId - the string's resource id of the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        messageResId - the string's resource id of the message of the dialog
        buttonTextResId - the string's resource id of the text of the positive button of the dialog

      • showYesNoDialog

        public static void showYesNoDialog(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.String title,
                   java.lang.String message,
                   CustomDialog.StandardDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a dialog with two possible actions, "yes" or "no"
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        title - the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        message - the message of the dialog
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "yes" tap (on "no" tap there's a simple dialog dismiss)

      • showYesNoDialog

        public static void showYesNoDialog(android.content.Context context,
                   int titleResId,
                   int messageResId,
                   CustomDialog.StandardDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a dialog with two possible actions, "yes" or "no"
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        titleResId - the string's resource id of the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        messageResId - the string's resource id of the message of the dialog
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "yes" tap

      • showEditDialog

        public static void showEditDialog(android.content.Context context,
                  int titleId,
                  int hintId,
                  int messageId,
                  int inputType,
                  java.lang.String lower,
                  java.lang.String upper,
                  CustomDialog.EditTextDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a dialog with an edit text, with all the given parameters to configure it
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        titleId - the string's resource id of the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        hintId - the string's resource id of the hint that should be displayed in the edit text. A null value removes the hint from the edit text
        messageId - the string's resource id of the message of the dialog, placed above the edit text. A null value removes the message from the dialog
        inputType - the input type of the edit text
        lower - lower bound of the edit text, to show an error message if the value of the edit text is lower. A null value removes the controls
        upper - upper bound of the edit text, to show an error message if the value of the edit text is higher. A null value removes the controls
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "ok" tap

      • showEditDialog

        public static void showEditDialog(android.content.Context context,
                  java.lang.String title,
                  java.lang.String hint,
                  java.lang.String message,
                  int inputType,
                  java.lang.String lower,
                  java.lang.String upper,
                  CustomDialog.EditTextDialogCallback callback)
        Shows a dialog with an edit text, with all the given parameters to configure it
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        title - the title that should be displayed at the top of the dialog
        hint - the hint that should be displayed in the edit text. A null value removes the hint from the edit text
        message - the message of the dialog, placed above the edit text. A null value removes the message from the dialog
        inputType - the input type of the edit text
        lower - lower bound of the edit text, to show an error message if the value of the edit text is lower. A null value removes the controls
        upper - upper bound of the edit text, to show an error message if the value of the edit text is higher. A null value removes the controls
        callback - the callback to determine the actions that should be done on "ok" tap

      • show

        public static android.app.ProgressDialog show(android.content.Context context,
                              int titleId,
                              int messageId)
        Shows a progress dialog
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        titleId - the string's resource id of the title of the progress dialog
        messageId - the string's resource id of the loading message of the dialog
        Returns:
        the progressDialog displayed

      • show

        public static android.app.ProgressDialog show(android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Shows a progress dialog
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        title - the title of the progress dialog
        message - the loading message of the dialog
        Returns:
        the progressDialog displayed

      • dismiss

        public static void dismiss(android.app.ProgressDialog dialog)
        Dismisses the given progress dialog
        Parameters:
        dialog - the progress dialog that has to be dismissed
